intro: Lupinus luteus f. golovczenkoi, commonly known as the Golovczénkoi lupine, is a botanical variant of the yellow lupine. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems, typical of the Lupinus genus. This subspecies is native to specific regions in Central Asia, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is a perennial plant that produces narrow, compound leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture and ecological restoration projects.
